result.execSummary:
The defendant Janet L Lombard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.
Consecutive to: any other sentence defendant is serving.

miscConds.notes: Amount to be determined at hearing scheduled for November 10, 2016 at 2:00 pm.
If probation or extended supervision is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Defendant shall not have direct or indirect contact with the Pike Lake House nor with Jeffrey S. except as required through the civil lawsuit or the restitution hearing.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling or treatment programs as directed by her supervising agent. 
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Restitution amount set at hearing on Nov 10, 2016 with $3,500 owed to Society Insurance and $1,799.13 to victim Jeffrey S. Def to be credited for $20 previously paid.  Resttitution modified to $0 per 3/23/17 Order to Amend JOC.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Preliminary Hearing 5/23/16

Def in person & by Atty Mike Kenitz. Victim Jeffrey Slough present. Christy Huber, representative from Society Insurance also present. Witnesses: Jeffrey S.; Christina H. Transcript of PH filed. Court finds that  victim has met burden and sets restitution at $5,299.13 plus 10% surcharge. Since Society has paid $3,500 to victim, $1,799.13 is owed to victim Jeffrey S. and $3,500 to Society Insurance. Def has paid $20 so credit is to be applied for amounts paid.
